meanings.definition: To carve or cut with a chisel.
meanings.sent1: He was chiseling a beautiful sculpture out of wood.
meanings.sent2: The artist was chiseling intricate patterns into the stone.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter joked that he was chiseling his way to an art show.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like chiseling away at his resolve.
meanings.sent5: The sound of chiseling echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The scammer was chiseling money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he had been chiseling her all along.
meanings.sent3: The con artist thought he could keep chiseling people forever.
meanings.sent4: His lies were slowly chiseling away at their trust.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman was chiseling his way to a bad reputation.

meanings.sent1: He was chiseling away at the marble to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The skilled craftsman was chiseling a new design into the metal.
meanings.sent3: The chiseler proudly displayed his latest creation to the world.
meanings.sent4: She was chiseling her way to becoming a renowned artist.
meanings.sent5: The young apprentice was chiseling under the guidance of a master.
